author: Maddy Baillie
title: Stamford Walk of Witness on Good Friday show real meaning of Easter
text: Stamford Walk of Witness on Good Friday show real meaning of Easter A large wooden cross was carried through a town’s streets with a parade of followers and hundreds of onlookers. More than 200 people flocked to [Stamford](https://www.lincsonline.co.uk/stamford/) High Street this afternoon (March 29) to take part in the Easter [Walk of Witness](https://www.lincsonline.co.uk/stamford/news/join-good-friday-walks-of-witness-9358519/), an event which has been taking place in the town for decades to mark Good Friday. A makeshift stage displayed the cross and was used for readings and prayers by members of the Churches Together community. The crowd joined in hymns accompanied by music from the Church Together Band. Mirroring the final hours of Jesus’ life, the wooden cross was then taken by Bob Black, who has carried it for the past two years, on a route along High Street and Broad Street. Get the news delivered straight to your inbox every morning - [sign up to The Briefing here](https://www.lincsonline.co.uk/newsletter/) At the top of Ironmonger Street the cross was put down while a hymn was sung. Hearing the drums, many passers-by stopped to watch and film the procession which carried on through Red Lion Square and onto the High Street once again. The cross was installed back into place atop the van and red fabric was attached to it. As further readings were given, there was a sudden April shower but people were undeterred. Instead they put up hoods and brollies or sheltered in shop doorways. The event was brought to a close with a prayer by the Rev Anthony Laotan, vicar of Christ Church, who spoke about how every day should be a walk of witness. “Every day we carry the cross. It is no longer an emblem of death but an emblem of life,” he said. Rob Shaw of Churches Together said he was impressed with the turnout and described the success of the event as testament to the hard work of many people. The crowd joined in The Lord's Prayer before dissipating. Did you attend the event? Let us know in the comments.
